intro: Syzygium hodgkinsoniae, commonly known as the Hodgkinson's apple. It is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrtaceae, native to northern Australia. The plant is a small to medium-sized tree that can grow up to 10 meters tall, with smooth, greyish bark and lance-shaped leaves. It produces small, white or pale pink flowers followed by edible, apple-like fruits. The plant is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments and is often found in woodland and dry rainforest habitats.
